metadata.title: CVE-2017-12904 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command inbookmarking function of Newsbeuter versions 0.7 through 2.9 allows remoteattackers to perform user-assisted code execution by crafting an RSS itemthat includes shell code in its title and/or URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

newsbeuter - 2.9-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: newsbeuter package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9-6').
